title: General Verbs Related to Health and Sickness
originalTitle: General Verbs Related to Health and Sickness

examples: The helicopter transported the injured person to the hospital.
The athlete injured his big toe during the soccer game and had to sit out the rest of the match.
The backup quarterback had to make up for the injured starter and lead the team to victory.
Each year thousands of people are killed and injured on the roads.
I used an ice pack to reduce the swelling on my injured knee.
words.defineEn: to get hurt, especially in an accident; to cause physical harm to someone
words.defineVi: bị thương, đặc biệt là trong một tai nạn; gây tổn hại về thể chất cho ai đó

examples: By this time, the cancer had metastasized.
Yes, the threat has metastasized around the world.
The problem of domestic terrorism has been metastasizing across the country for a long time now.
And it's metastasized to the liver.
The reason is breast cancer metastasizes to bone.
words.defineEn: spread throughout the body
words.defineVi: lan khắp cơ thể

examples: After 98 days at sea, dozens of sailors had succumbed to scurvy and famine.
I succumbed to cancer 10 years later.
They often succumb to disease, to alcoholism, to violence.
After days or weeks of suffering, the rhinos and other animals eventually succumbed, and were slowly buried in ash.
Huayna Capac, the leader of the Incan empire, succumbed to smallpox before Pizarro even arrived.
words.defineEn: to die as a result of a disease or injury
words.defineVi: chết do bệnh tật hoặc chấn thương

examples: He suffered a traumatic brain injury in a car accident.
When the storm arrived, his house suffered significant damage.
They've suffered a heart attack, maybe two.
Britain has suffered a huge brain drain in recent years.
You planted the seed of greed yourself, now you must suffer the consequences.
words.defineEn: to have an illness or disease
words.defineVi: để có một bệnh tật hoặc bệnh tật

examples: I need to format my external hard drive before transferring files to it.
Transfer tape makes light work of re-gluing in the workshop.
And the iPod's FireWire connector transferred songs faster than USB.
Transfers are locking up everywhere.
So again, the bat can transfer the infection to other animals.
words.defineEn: to transmit a disease to another person or animal, which makes them infected with the same disease
words.defineVi: để truyền bệnh cho người khác hoặc động vật, mà làm cho họ bị nhiễm bệnh tương tự

examples: When you're a nurse, cleaning up vomit is all in a day's work.
Mark had a habit of getting involved in toxic relationships, but he found himself drawn back to the same kind of people, like a dog returns to its vomit.
- I vomited.
First, he fed the vomit to dogs.
And my vomit had kind of turned a funny colour at this point.
words.defineEn: to eject what has been eaten or drunk through the mouth
words.defineVi: để đẩy những gì đã được ăn hoặc uống qua miệng

examples: The smallest thing aggravates you.
And it can only aggravate the issue.
Keep in mind every time you increase the dose, it could aggravate your anxiety.
Gregory McMichael and his son Travis were charged with murder and aggravated assault.
That has, I think, aggravated divisions that were already there.
words.defineEn: to make a disease or medical condition worse or more serious
words.defineVi: để làm cho một căn bệnh hoặc tình trạng y tế tồi tệ hơn hoặc nghiêm trọng hơn

examples: The film caught a cold over the outstanding debt.
A vase on a side table caught his eye.
The new law caught them unawares.
He caught a glimpse of his reflection in the glass.
As she turned back, a movement across the lawn caught her eye.
words.defineEn: to get sick, usually with bacteria or a virus
words.defineVi: bị bệnh, thường là do vi khuẩn hoặc vi rút

examples: The company has held the advertising contract since 2005.
Contracts and leases to work the mines.
Our competitors obtained the contract by breaking every rule in the book.
That contract proved to be a millstone around his neck.
The company has won a contract to supply books and materials to schools.
words.defineEn: (mostly used with chronic diseases) to get infected by a disease or virus
words.defineVi: (chủ yếu được sử dụng với các bệnh mãn tính) bị nhiễm bệnh hoặc vi rút

examples: You ought to see a doctor about that cough.
She broke the silence by coughing.
The doctor has given me some medicine to take for my cough.
It just goes to show that love and cough cannot be hidden.
He enjoys a spoonful of honey before bed to help calm his cough and promote a good night's sleep.
words.defineEn: to push air out of our mouth with a sudden noise
words.defineVi: để đẩy không khí ra khỏi miệng của chúng tôi với một tiếng ồn đột ngột

examples: Over the years, he developed a reputation as a penny pincher who wouldn't spend money for anything.
The startup is developing cutting-edge technology, boldly going where no man has gone before in the quest for innovation.
The company hedged its bets by developing a second line of products.
Developing a complex software program from scratch within a tight deadline is a herculean task for the development team.
The two colleagues worked together closely and, over time, developed a strong rapport.
words.defineEn: to start to have a particular disease or problem
words.defineVi: để bắt đầu có một bệnh cụ thể hoặc vấn đề

examples: They m ailed us actually like over a year old brownies.
But one way or another, it shows that they’ve found a treatment to kill the flies that ail them.
It was supposed to cure basically whatever ails you.
And, look, we're going to continue, as we did with the past set of federal dollars, to give that straight to these ailing businesses, these folks who, frankly, have been on the front lines.
People faced a heartbreaking decision: whether to risk caring for their ailing loved ones, or leave them to die alone in the hopes of avoiding infection.
words.defineEn: to make someone physically sick or to cause mental trouble
words.defineVi: để làm cho ai đó bị bệnh về thể chất hoặc gây rắc rối về tinh thần

words.defineEn: the reflex act of disgorging the contents of the stomach through the mouth
words.defineVi: hành động phản xạ của việc giải phóng nội dung của dạ dày qua miệng

words.defineEn: to state that one feels ill or one's body part is in pain
words.defineVi: để nói rằng một người cảm thấy bị bệnh hoặc một phần cơ thể của một người đang bị đau

examples: So, their cells dehydrate rather than freeze.
WILLIAM BRANGHAM: Exactly at the moment when you're incredibly dehydrated because of the pneumonia.
It's going to dehydrate you, which is the opposite of what you want.
You're really just dehydrating the fruit, and that's what's taking so long, but the end result is worth it.
That generally happens when you're dehydrated
words.defineEn: to lose a large amount of fluid through urinating, vomiting, or intense physical activity
words.defineVi: để mất một lượng lớn chất lỏng thông qua đi tiểu, nôn mửa, hoặc hoạt động thể chất cường độ cao

words.defineEn: to be confined to bed due to being ill or injured
words.defineVi: phải nằm liệt giường do bị ốm hoặc bị thương

examples: Terrible pain, might pass out.
Ben Franklin, he passed out pamphlets.
Then you passed out again.
Before you pass out.
Did she pass out?
words.defineEn: to lose consciousness
words.defineVi: mất ý thức

examples: The lawyer presented the right argument in court.
Bring Helen a present.
Bring a present for Helen.
He presented a false document as evidence in the court case.
Our hosts presented us with an embarrassment of riches.
words.defineEn: to have or exhibit particular signs or symptoms during a medical check-up
words.defineVi: có hoặc biểu hiện các dấu hiệu hoặc triệu chứng cụ thể trong quá trình kiểm tra y tế

examples: But the threat of relapse is always there.
But, real relapse symptoms don't come on as quickly as a day or two.
This is different from a relapse.
In this case, a return of your symptoms would be considered a relapse of your illness.
Discharged with a prescription for another opioid painkiller, Percocet, she relapsed.
words.defineEn: to become sick again after an improvement in one's health
words.defineVi: bị ốm trở lại sau khi sức khỏe của một người được cải thiện

examples: Guy sneezed loudly.
She sneezed into her elbow to cover her nose.
He sneezes.
Every sneeze starts right inside your nose.
However, this simple sneeze also brings the virus in contact with pets, plants, or even your lunch.
words.defineEn: to blow air out of our nose and mouth in a sudden way
words.defineVi: thổi không khí ra khỏi mũi và miệng của chúng ta một cách đột ngột

examples: She fainted and hit her head on the metal bedstead.
I haven’t the faintest idea what you mean.
Her coach reminded her that faint heart never won fair lady, and encouraged her to push her limits.
After Lily fainted, we used smelling salts to bring her to life.
And Dexter tried to calm his faint resentment against her for casting a shadow over his optimistic mood.
words.defineEn: to suddenly lose consciousness from a lack of oxygen in the brain, which is caused by a shock, etc.
words.defineVi: đột nhiên mất ý thức do thiếu oxy trong não, nguyên nhân là do sốc, v.v.
